metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0763 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The setGlobalContext method in org/apache/naming/factory/ResourceLinkFactory.java in Apache Tomcat 7.x before 7.0.68, 8.x before 8.0.31, and 9.x before 9.0.0.M3 does not consider whether ResourceLinkFactory.setGlobalContext callers are authorized, which allows remote authenticated users to bypass intended SecurityManager restrictions and read or write to arbitrary application data, or cause a denial of service (application disruption), via a web application that sets a crafted global context. It was discovered that the Tomcat setGlobalContext method incorrectly checked if callers were authorized. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to read or wite to arbitrary application data, or cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0763` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.45+dfsg-1
No subscription required

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.68-1
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7 - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7-common - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7-user - 7.0.68-1
No subscription required

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.45+dfsg-1').
tomcat7 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.68-1').
tomcat8 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1').
